about.title: About Me
about.content: I am a core developer at Southeast University's Messenger Program Studio, with extensive experience in team development with studio members, having undertaken multiple on-campus and off-campus development projects. Additionally, I have full-stack developed and launched a graduate admissions management system for a renowned on-campus laboratory. In terms of open-source contributions, I have successfully submitted PRs for new feature development to open-source browser extension repositories. I constantly follow the latest developments in frontend technology and AI field dynamics, with practical experience in prompt engineering, large model fine-tuning, Agent, MCP, and other areas. I am firmly committed to frontend development direction and passionate about the internet industry and technology.

education.title: Education
education.details: School of Computer Science and Engineering | Artificial Intelligence | Bachelor

skills.title: Technical Skills
items: Familiar with common HTML and HTML5 elements, CSS/CSS3 basic syntax and layout.
Familiar with JavaScript and ES6 syntax features, understand TypeScript, understand common design patterns.
Familiar with React framework, proficient in using React with mainstream component libraries for development, understand Vue3 framework.
Understand HTTP/HTTPS protocol, TCP/IP and other computer network knowledge, understand browser principles and working methods.
Master the use of frontend engineering tools such as Vite and Webpack.
Familiar with Git usage, have full-stack development experience.

items.name: QuAIz - AI-Powered Exam Generation and Grading System
items.description: An AI-driven online intelligent exam generation and grading system that implements a complete closed loop from intelligent exam generation, online answering to automatic grading for 6 question types (single choice, multiple choice, fill-in-the-blank, short answer, code output, code writing), integrating multiple large model APIs with streaming component rendering and virtualization performance optimization.
features: Implemented synchronous JSON parsing for SSE-style output, streaming real-time rendering of question components, significantly reducing rendering wait time.
Implemented virtualization rendering technology based on react-window, solving the scrolling white screen problem of log panels, supporting 10000+ log components without lag.
Used React.memo + custom comparison functions to reduce unnecessary re-renders, optimized computation time through useMemo/useCallback caching.
Based on React.forwardRef, implemented a virtualized log list higher-order component that forwards ref to internal List components.
Developed custom Hooks for form state management and submission logic, encapsulated business logic, combined with Zustand to optimize state management.
Designed unified toolchain, integrated ESLint + Prettier + CommitLint specifications, improved code standardization.
